intro: Combretum goossensii, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that turn red or orange during the dry season. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. The bark is smooth and can be used in traditional medicine in some regions.
